alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Kershaw; Lancaster; Lee; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 11 at 2:43PM EDT until June 11 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Fairfield County in central South Carolina... Southeastern Lancaster County in central South Carolina... Northwestern Lee County in central South Carolina... Northeastern Richland County in central South Carolina... Central Kershaw County in central South Carolina... * Until 330 PM EDT. * At 243 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Villages at Sandhill, or near Dentsville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Columbia, Camden, Lake Wateree Dam, Dentsville, Lugoff, Westville, Sesquicentennial State Park, Lake Carolina, Villages at Sandhill, Cassatt, Elgin, Goodale State Park, Killian, North Central High School, Dekalb, North Towne Square Shopping Center, Antioch, Fort Jackson Wildcat Road, Midway Elementary School and Pine Grove Fire Station. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 77 and 102. Interstate 77 between mile markers 21 and 23. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. Severe thunderstorms can produce large capsizing waves and frequent lightning. If on or near Lake Wateree move away from the water and take shelter! Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways or walk through high water.
